name: Bar Lounge and Conservatory - Skiddaw Hotel

reviews.text: I had visited Keswick several times over the years, and was trying to re-discover a pub/restaurant that had been very satisfying to my traveling companions back in 2007. I was unable to find that same pub, but my present companions and I decided to eat at this hotel instead. Upon perusing the menu outside, I noticed that they offered a lamb shank, which I had been craving for the past two weeks!
reviews.title: Pleasant food and atmosphere in a hotel in the centre of Keswick.
Overpriced
reviews.text: We ate in the bar/lounge, rather than in the main hotel dining room, and the food was quite good. In addition to my very large, excellent lamb shank, my companions enjoyed a marvelous fish dinner and a large, varied ploughman's platter. Prices were reasonable, considering that Keswick is a bit of a tourist magnet, being in the middle of the Lake District.
Our bartender/server, Marcus, was very friendly and helpful, even though he was very busy at the beginning of the evening. He appeared to need more help taking orders.
reviews.title: Disappointing dinner
Helpful and friendly
reviews.text: I would return here in the future!

reviews.title: Great place to celebrate the New Year
reviews.text: We stopped off here for dinner one night last week as the pizza place we had been aiming for was full - the prices are quite steep compared with other nearby restaurants, so we were expecting something a little special. Sadly we were rather disappointed - a smallish Greek salad for over £6 doesn't even come accompanied with a morsel of bread, and the pies & chips my parents ordered were soggy and the meat felt very low in quality. I would expect this standard of food from a motorway service cafe or similar, and at half the price.
